I am a Web Applications Developer. Currently, I maintain servers and sites for a lead generation company. Previously, leading a Web Development team in a corporate setting. I maintain a service and personal projects in my free time.

Skills

I have a handle on multiple facets of Software Development, Technical Leadership, and non-dev roles like Management and Team Building/Development.

I have a well rounded skillset and can be reliable in specializing in any one facet. My corporate background would indicate I can carry out Leadership roles. Development-wise, I regard myself heavily opinionated and capable in UI Engineering and basic User Experience design.

This visualization is the distribution of my skills grouped by category. This is based upon proficiency and confidence in practical use. As a whole it reflects my coverage in Technical Leadership.

Design Approach

In practice I follow a priority-based approach in designing and developing applications. In general, User Experience is first priority, followed closely by Performance and Scalability. The rest are shuffled around variably to compensate for compromises in any of the first two priorities.

In terms of tech stack, I am currently invested in server-side JS, non-relational databases, lean front end tech, and AWS Cloud platform for staging and deployment. In the past I have used the LAMP stack heavily and have had success with it in large-scale production use.

I welcome trying new tools and processes, if they seem a better fit to solve the problem.

As a Computer Science graduate, in all my endeavors, I follow
an all-encompassing, simple yet powerful design guide.

Experience

My corporate background is for the most part Technical Management and Leadership, for 4 years in a Digital Agency. I have handled UI Design and Development projects as a contractor. I also maintain a handful of full-stack personal projects, which would speak best about my personal approach in development.

Looking For Work

I am looking for work in either of the following fields.

  • Technical Leadership and Development, I have been succesful in this field during my corporate stint, and I am looking to further hone my skills here. If you are building an office, launching a new department, or have an existing team that needs technical guidance, we may be a good match.
  • UI/UX Development and Design, I am new to this but I have some work experience and it has always been a big interest of mine, I wish to explore this field further as well as someday find a place for myself in its community. I'm looking for someone who needs help in UI Engineering where I can be immediately applicable, and at the same time someone who is willing to teach or apprentice in terms of UX Design.
  • Product Design & Development. I have an affinity for minimal specific solutions more than general swiss-army-knife solutions. I have an understanding of Software Development methods (including Lean), as well as fully capable in prototyping or engineering in any development facet. I value growth and scale as much as I value code. I am fine with fast iteration rounds, rapid protoyping, and validating ideas through testing or research. If this is you, we might make a good match.
